description.narrative: Support the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Uzbekistan and other ministries and agencies of Uzbekistan to implement the Action Strategy on five priority directions of development of Uzbekistan adopted by the Government for 2017-2021.

activity-description.narrative: CCI and other UNDP projects prepared 4 business and investment guides, including for Kuyichirchik district of Tashkent region, Kashkadarya, Syrdarya and Surkhandarya regions
Improving quality of services of Business Facilitation Centers of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry in each region of Uzbekistan

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1. % of recommendations stemming from project analytical papers on further improvement of the performance of OSS accepted by the Government. 2. Number of business process reengineering proposals adopted by national partners to improve service delivery to businesses in the regional OSS. 3. Availability of the Public-Private Partnership project in the Government to improve utility service delivery in the region(s). 4. Availability of focused methodological toolkits and financing models for the development of youth and women startup and entrepreneurship in the relevant national and regional government agencies, educational institutions, banks, private sector partner organizations and experts; 5. Number of youth and women who started entrepreneurship that were initiated as a result of participating at the innovative startup support programmes implemented in cooperation with higher education institutions, public and private organizations and experts; 6. Number of analytical briefs with concrete recommendations on creating enabling environment for businesses prepared by CCI staff. 7. Number of OSS staff trained to provide at least 2 new services to businesses.

comment.narrative: Targets for 2018 1. At least 60% 2. 1 3. Concept of PPP project drafted 4. Methodological toolkits developed 5. 1 6. 1 7. 14

1. In close cooperation with related departments and experts of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Uzbekistan (CCI), and engagement of national consultants, comprehensive survey (in 13 regions and Tashkent city) and evaluation of the scope and quality of the services provided by Business Facilitation Centers (BFC) in all regions of Uzbekistan were organised. As a result, an analytical paper (with recommendations) on improvement of the quality and efficiency of the services provided by BFC and increasing their scope and coverage was prepared and submitted (by CCI) to the National Agency for Projects Management under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan and the Cabinet of Ministers of Uzbekistan. Besides, in close collaboration of the State Customs Committee and CCI elaborated comprehensive questionnaire and carried out survey among export-import companies, customs brokers, and other participants of foreign trade and prepared several analytical reports with recommendations: - Analytical paper and recommendations on progressive foreign experience in improving customs regulation and easing customs processes; - Analytical paper and recommendations on improvement of the rating of Uzbekistan in yearly report of World Bank on “Doing Business” (in regard to “trading across borders indicator). The project also organized an international conference on export promotion, as a result of which CCI (with the support of the project) prepared set of recommendations on further improvement of customs administration and easing foreign trade in Uzbekistan and submitted to the Cabinet of Minister of Uzbekistan. 2. In close cooperation with related departments and experts of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Uzbekistan (CCI), and engagement of national consultants, comprehensive survey (in 13 regions and Tashkent city) and evaluation of the scope and quality of the services provided by Business Facilitation Centers (BFC) in all regions of Uzbekistan were organised. As a result, an analytical paper (with recommendations) on improvement of the quality and efficiency of the services provided by BFC and increasing their scope and coverage was prepared and submitted (by CCI) to the National Agency for Projects Management under the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan and the Cabinet of Ministers of Uzbekistan. 3. In close cooperation with related departments and experts of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Uzbekistan (CCI), other national stakeholders and engagement of national consultants, draft concept paper for establishment of Experts’ Council of CCI for Public Private Partnership (PPP) and the draft strategy for support and promotion of PPP projects by CCI were elaborated. The project also prepared analytical paper on identification of the sector for elaboration and implementation of PPP project and prepared draft concept of PPP project in tourism sector in Uzbekistan. The project in collaboration with CCI and other UNDP projects prepared 4 business and investment guides, including for Quyichirchik district of Tashkent region, Kashkadarya, Syrdarya and Surkhandarya regions. Moreover, a special Manual for preparation of business and investment guides on regional levels in Uzbekistan was elaborated. 4. In order to understand the overall scope, focus and contents of the planned toolkits, relevant foreign and national experience and program materials were reviewed, several comparable toolkits and source materials identified and analysed. Together with staff of National partner agency and based on previous joint project experience, relevant national youth and entrepreneurship development programs and documents (Yoshlar Kelajagimiz, regulations of Ministry of Innovative development), decrees and resolutions are analysed. Meetings and discussions conducted with key public and private sector organizations and experts, partnership opportunities and mechanisms for joint development and promotion of toolkits discussed (General prosecutors’ office). Based on discussions, the need, for the following 4 toolkits were identified: 1) “Starting a business” with template and guide on business plan development; 2) “Marketing” with tools on different marketing ways; 3) “Finance” with templates of worksheets for cashflow; and 4) “PR and SMM” for increasing profits of small businesses. The first draft of the 4 toolkits are developed and expected to be sent to relevant ministries and agencies, private sector organizations and experts in order to collect their views and feedback, and include them in preparing the final versions. The planned toolkits will be used to enrich the practical guidebooks on developing business plan and marketing developed in Uzbek by UNDP AfT project. The toolkit will cover issues of starting a small business, and will include templates of business plan and guidance on using them. The panned toolkits will be concise, rich with illustrations, and will have online tutorial with test questions. The toolkits will be divided into reading sections that are finished by test questions, which will be available on Chamber.uz domain. Successful test takers will be issued a Certificate, which can be saved and printed. Potential entrepreneurs can also download the template for developing their business plan. In addition, short animated video-film are expected to be prepared as teasers for sharing them on Telegram groups and social media, on TV etc. to publicize the toolkit and attract youth and women, and potential to be businessman to use them. The same approach will be used for other toolkits on Marketing for small business, Finance for small business, PR and Social Media for small business. Potential partner agencies and sources of financing are also being identified and studied, several meetings conducted with representatives of foreign, bilateral and multilateral development organizations (US, Korea, UK and Austria). 5. Best international experience, methodological materials and programs of relevant organizations (accelerators, co-working centers, business incubators, labs and funds) and provided support services and skills development programs on supporting innovative startup-initiatives been studied. CCI and UNDP project experience, relevant local programs, documents and policy priorities, key public and private organizations and partnership opportunities for implementing youth and women innovative startup-initiatives support programs studied and analysed. Meetings and discussions with relevant organizations (Ministry of higher education, TUIT, INHA, WIUT) and experts (leading IT experts and startup founders), and regional stakeholders (CCI, TUIT, Youth union branches) conducted, partnership opportunities to implement youth and women innovative startup-initiatives support program, particularly in the regions, reviewed. Regulation for implementing youth and women innovative startup-initiatives support program, covering aims and objectives, application and selection mechanisms, criteria, program contents, and implementing regional and national stages of programme developed and endorsed by 6 ministries and agencies, including CCI, Mininnovations, Youth union, Mininfocom, Minhighereducation and State committee on supporting the privatized enterprises and development of competition. New posters and website (http://startup.chamber.uz) developed, application forms on “Google Forms” improved, agreement with key stakeholders (Youth Union and Ministry of Innovations) and experts for joint launch and implementation of the support programme established. The Ministry of innovative development agreed to provide 200 mln. UZS to best startups. The third cycle of the youth startup support programme launched, covering and accepting applications from all the regions of Uzbekistan. The program specialists visited and conducted presented the program to youth in 8 regions. In remaining 4 regions and all the other regions the programme conducted presentation via video-conference system of Ministry of higher education with participation of youth and students from 76 universities countrywide. 510 applications were received, 247 from Tashkent and 263 from the regions Uzbekistan, 407 from students (of which 197 from Tashkent and 210 from regional universities) and 103 from the private sector. From total applications 81 were women headed. The 44% of applicants were aged at 21-24, 26% at 26-30 and 18% up to 20 years old. Infographics was developed with detailed analysis of the applications. 268 projects were selected for the interviews conducted in Tashkent and the regions via CCI’s videoconference system and 92 projects were identified for the programme in four locations: 32 project teams in Tashkent, 26 project teams in Fergana (covering Andijan, Fergana and Namangan), 21 projects teams in Samarkand (covering Jizzakh, Samarkand, Navoi, Bukhara, Kashkadarya and Surkhandarya), and 16 project in Nukus (covering Karakalpak Republic and Khorezm region). More than 250 youth participated in training seminars on developing startups based on Lean startup methodology. Special workbook of the training with more than 600 slides covering 11 thematic modules, was published and handed to every participant of the seminar. After the seminars 5 master classes and training on preparing and making presentations were conducted engaging known local and foreign experts. 18 projects teams (of which 13 projects from Tashkent and 5 projects from the regions) reached the final stage of the program and presented results of their work at the Demo-day on December 19, 2018. Special brochure was prepared and published containing detailed information about the 18 startup projects for potential investors. Five best startups (of which 1 project from the region) received 40 mln.UZS each (200 mln UZS, around US$24,000) for the development of their startups from Mininnovations, Certificates, smartphones, free subscriptions for use of working spaces from Ground Zero and C-Space co-working centers. The finalists included projects in the field of education, trading platforms based on virtual reality, crowdfunding platforms for startups, bionic prosthesis production service, automated trade and catering management systems and other projects in medicine, advertising and tourism sectors. It is expected that at least 5 projects are going to be started as business as a result of participating in the youth startup support programme. The project will continue assisting startup teams in attracting investment and partnership relations. Two concepts of project proposals on 1) Supporting the development of youth startups in Uzbekistan and 2) Empowering girls in Fergana Valley by enhancing their skills and abilities for using modern technologies for the total amount of 153 000 USDs were developed and submitted to the British Embassy in Uzbekistan for funding. 6. Several documents regarding the youth employment and entrepreneurship, innovation development and funding mechanisms developed by relevant ministries reviewed and comments with concrete recommendations prepared and submitted to CCI. Four separate brief proposals with recommendations and reasoning on creating enabling environment for businesses and youth innovative entrepreneurship development prepared and submitted to Ministry of Innovative Development, Committee of the Senat and Adviser of the President’s Administration: - Analytical paper and recommendations on progressive foreign experience in improving customs regulation and easing customs processes; - Analytical paper and recommendations on improvement of the rating of Uzbekistan in yearly report of World Bank on “Doing Business” (in regard to “trading across borders indicator); - As an outcome of seminar on improving customs and administration and easing and boosting foreign trade, set of recommendations on further improvement of customs administration and easing foreign trade in Uzbekistan. 7. A special training seminar on improving customs and administration and easing and boosting foreign trade for more than 30 specialists of the States Customs Committee, Ministry of Foreign Trade, and others was organised.
Targets for 2019 1. At least 60% 2. 2 3. Model of the PPP project 4. Financing models developed 5. 3 6. 1 7. 28

1.The project prepared analytical report "World experience in introducing the institution of authorized economic operator" with analytical note on introduction of institution of authorized economic operators in Uzbekistan. Based on the analytical papers the project also prepared draft Resolution of Cabinet of Ministers of Republic of Uzbekistan “On measures of introducing the institute of authorized economic operator” with explanatory note. On April 17, 2019 the project supported the organization of a round table on: “Improving the position of Uzbekistan in the Doing Business rating: achieved results and priority areas”. The event became a kind of unified platform for dialogue between government agencies and the business community. 2.Based on the survey among export/import companies, customs brokers and other participants of foreign economic activity, services of customs clearance were analyzed and based on the survey results, a support to development of a betta version of the mobile application for customs (which aims contribute to decreasing of times spent for customs procedures during export-import operations) was provided. 3. No progress was made due to project's earlier closure. 4. Analytical note developed with review of international experience, situation in Uzbekistan and provision of recommendations on improving financing for startups at early stages of development 5. It is expected that at least 5 projects are going to be started as business as a result of participating in the youth startup support programme. The project will continue assisting startup teams in attracting investment and partnership relations 6.As a result of the international conference on export promotion, CCI prepared set of recommendations on further improvement of customs administration and easing foreign trade in Uzbekistan and submitted to the Cabinet of Minister of Uzbekistan. 7. The CCI and Uzbek Embassy in Austria two 3-day special training seminar was organized for more than 30 representatives of the SCC, Ministry for Foreign Trade, NAPM and other state bodies in March 2019.
